title: Finley Malloc
text: Finley Malloc is the Chief Data Scientist at Wengo Analytics. When not innovating on data platforms, Finley enjoys spending time unicycling and playing with her pet iguana.

title: Poppy J. Hesketh-Best, Ph.D
text: Poppy J. Hesketh-Best, Ph.D, is a bioinformatician and computational biologist specializing in microbial genomics, modular BASH workflows, and scalable data analysis pipelines. She develops reproducible and shareable pipelines for pathogen surveillance and genomic epidemiology, with experience in SARS-CoV-2, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, HIV, and honey-bee viruses. When not coding for high-performance computing clusters, she enjoys exploring novel bioinformatics tools for genome assembly, annotation, and phylogenetic analyses.

title: Poppy J. Hesketh-Best, Ph.D
text:
Professional Appointments
IGTP / University Hospital Germans Trias i Pujol | Bioinformatics Investigator | 2024 – Present
- Lead bioinformatician in the Pathogen Diagnostics and Genomic Epidemiology (DxEpiPath) group.
- Writing, implementing, and maintaining pipelines for genomic surveillance of viral and bacterial pathogens.
- Conducting research on bioinformatic methods for microbial genomics.
University of Minnesota, USA | Postdoctoral Research Associate | 2023 – 2024
- Investigated genomics of honey-bee RNA viruses and developed automated pipelines for Oxford Nanopore sequencing data.
University of Miami, USA | Postdoctoral Research Associate | 2022 – 2023
- Studied viral ecology of phototrophic anaerobic bacteriophages and horizontal gene exchange in metagenomes.
- Mentored PhD students and supported laboratory management.
British Antarctic Survey, UK | Postdoctoral Research Assistant | 2021 – 2022
- Sequenced Antarctic invertebrate metagenomes and benchmarked Nanopore VolTRAX2 for rapid genomic analysis.

title: Poppy J. Hesketh-Best, Ph.D
text:
Technical Skills

Computational/Software: BASH, Nextflow, Quarto, R, Python; HPC environments (SLURM, SGE); 16S rRNA, metagenomics, RNA viral genomics, Nanopore and Illumina sequencing.

Molecular Biology & Genomics: PCR, DNA/RNA extraction, library prep for Nanopore, cDNA synthesis.

Cell Culture & Microbiology: Culturing environmental microbes, biofilm assays, flow cytometry.

title: Poppy J. Hesketh-Best, Ph.D
text:
Projects

TB-SEQ: Genomic epidemiology strategy for tuberculosis contacts in Catalonia (2024-2026).

COVID-19 Vaccine Effectiveness: Brand-specific vaccine surveillance across Europe (2024-2025).

Honey Bee Virus Dynamics: Investigating hygienic behavior and virus transmission (2022-2024).
